TopicTitle: Why is the landing gear always activated when you launch?

Articles.Content:
Hello Community,

this bugs me since I play this game. When you launch a rocket, the gear indicator below the brake and light indicator is always activated. When I want to use my landing gear, I have to press G to "deactivate" it, then press G again to actually deploy my landing gear.

Is there a reason for this madness?

Greetings!

Known bug/feature thing. The gear light always "starts" on, but the parts don't actually respond to that. I'd bet you it's because SQUAD wanted the parts to be on by default for user-friendliness, but for some reason it didn't work.

Temporary solution: rightclick the landing gears in the vehicle assembly building, and extend then from there. Thus, the vehicle will always be launched with the landing gears out. Since we don't have "real" aerodynamics yet, they won't snap off during flight through the atmosphere (They might, if you use FAR.)

Hope this helps!
Aircraft. They almost all start with gear deployed and then retract them after takeoff.

Working as intended AFAIK.

It is because of the small gear bays. those start deployed by default, while the Landing struts do not. but both are controlled by the same control, so the first press will retract small gear bays but not deploy the struts.

Aircraft.

This came into my mind just as I was clicking on "Post it".

Yeah, the aircraft landing gear starts always deployed ( for a reason!). Maybe one day Squad can make the game distinguish between rocket landing legs and aircraft landing legs.

It's not a game breaker, but it's annoying when you try to land per IVA and forget you have to push G twice. Don't trust those indicators in the cockpit

They should probably have the inticator on by default for ships launched from the SPH, and off by default for ships launched from the VAB, since the gear bays usually start deployed but the other landing gear don't.
Why don't they just make it so that it is always on when gear is deployed in the assembly buildings and always off when the gear is up.

One similar bug in this area: if you have an action group for the small gear bay set to toggle them, on launch, you have to fire the action twice to retract the wheels.

Pretty simple solution for this problem - if no gear are deployed, the light shouldn't be lit. If at least one pair (no matter the type) is deployed, light it. Should cover most, if not all cases, including fringe cases. Launch a rocket + lander with gears retracted = light off. Same, but gears deployed = light on. Launch plane = light on. Launch plane that has a standard lander in cargo bay (somehow) = light on. Launch rocket + wheeled lander = depends if gear are retracted in editor or not. Launch plane with retracted gear + standard lander with extended gear = ok, this time it's wrong, but you wouldn't be going anywhere anyway.

It should be assumed that any deployed gear are, for want of a better word, dominant and in use, therefore the light should reflect their state.
